item.title: Firemaking - creating global objects
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:13, topic:413317”][quote author=I Roll Deep link=topic=514819.msg3738035#msg3738035 date=1315085521]

sendObject(X, Y);
idk never worked with it, but there should be some kind of coors variale like for x and y.

sendObject(X, Y, objectID);?

Shoulda be something like it, I’ll test now
[/quote]
You can just find the method instead of randomly experimenting… >.>

public void sendObject(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int objectHeight, int objectFace, int objectType) {[quote author=jmood128 link=topic=514819.msg3738043#msg3738043 date=1315085882]

We don’t need the name of the source you downloaded… We need the base.

Delta
PI
Hyperion
Etc.

Delta looks messy as heck with files every where.
PI Is somewhat organized having files within the main server file named,

Bin
Com
Data
Deps

Etc.

Don’t know much about other sources. ^.^

I guess technically you can say it’s based off of WinterLove… But it can also be classified as a scratch server…
[/quote]
If you’re talking about RuneSource, are you stupid? RuneSource was written entirely from scratch, if you ‘technically’ said it was based off WinterLove you’d be dumber than a fly.[/quote]

Read full topic

Don’t know much about other sources. ^.^

I guess technically you can say it’s based off of WinterLove… But it can also be classified as a scratch server…[/quote]
If you’re talking about RuneSource, are you stupid? RuneSource was written entirely from scratch, if you ‘technically’ said it was based off WinterLove you’d be dumber than a fly.

item.title: Firemaking - creating global objects
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

pk2play:

Does runesource even support this yet?

Since there’s a method to create global objects it should.
You have a class where you can add objects, but they are permanent.
GlobalObject,GlobalObjectHandler are the classes based on creating objects.
There’s a way to do it, just I always get the same:
sendObject cannot be applied to (int, int) etc…

Read full topic

item.title: Firemaking - creating global objects
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

Hey.
I’m working on Firemaking for my server, based of RuneSource v1.0
Everything works fine, except creating the object on floor.
Some1 help?

public static void createGlobalObject(Player player) { for (Player players : World.getPlayers()) { if (players == null) { continue; } for (GlobalObject object : objects) { if (Misc.getDistance(players.getPosition(), object.getPosition()) <= 16) { players.getActionSender().sendObject(object); } } } }

Read full topic
